results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia

results.title: Morvern Callar
results.creator_credit: Lynne Ramsay, Robyn Slovo, George Faber, Charles Pattinson, BBC Film Unit and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: After the death of her boyfriend a young aimless English woman living in the West of Scotland, assumes the authorship of his unpublished novel and absconds to Spain on a spiritual journey of self-discovery. Silently grieving and struggling to come to terms with his suicide, Morvern is an ambiguous character whose extreme actions belie her gentle, unassuming air. There is something wonderfully maladroit about Samantha Morton’s performance, expertly conveying Morvern’s despair, as she reconciles the calamitous events that subsequently turn to good fortune. The depressing milieu of the Scottish scenes contrast with Morvern’s liberation in sun drenched Spain as she begins to revel in her freedom.

results.title: Lilya 4-ever = Lilya forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lukas Moodysson, Lars Jonsson, Zentropa and Memfis
results.brief_description: Lukas Moodyson (Show me love, Together) delivers a bleak and melancholic story of a young Russian girl Lilya (Oksana Akinshina) who is abandoned by her mother (absconding to America with a boyfriend), deceived by her aunt and guardian and then betrayed by a friend who ruins Lilya’s reputation and consequently, her life. By a series of misunderstandings Lilya falls into prostitution and is then duped by an older man into believing a new life awaits her in the West. Once there however Lilya is forced into an array of humiliating and degrading circumstances that drive her to the brink. Set in the former Soviet Union, this is a somewhat desolate tale of dehumanisation, which contrasts starkly to the sunniness and humour of Moodyson’s “Together”, drawing on the grave themes of parent abandonment, child prostitution and human trafficking. Also available on VHS [318953].

results.title: Volcano high = Whasango
results.creator_credit: Tae-kyun Kim, Cha Sung-jai, Sidus, Cinema Service and Media Asia Group
results.brief_description: Peer group pressure at High School is on a whole other level when the students go to a fantastical school for those good in martial arts. Students and teachers alike seem to be gifted but there is the usual pecking order of the leaders and the losers. Onto his ninth school, the new boy nicknamed ‘transfer’ is set upon by the nasty leader of the schoolyard, Ryang, but he is surprised by the new boy’s power. Teenagers battle it out in this mythical and fun filled fight film full of whimsy and slapstick.

results.title: City of God = Cidade de Deus
results.creator_credit: Fernando Meirelles, Mauricio Andrade Ramos, Andrea Barata Ribeiro, VideoFilmes Production and O2 Filmes
results.brief_description: Award winning cinema, this directorial masterpiece by Fernando Meirelles is violent, disturbing and skillful storytelling. The story unfolds in the slums of Rio de Janeiro’s “City of God”, a housing project built in the 1960s that becomes by the ‘80s a city engulfed by gang warfare. Based on a true story and a novel by Paulo Lins, young Busca-Pe (aka Rocket) grows up amongst this violence and we learn the history of the gangs through a series of stories told in flashback style with him as narrator. Rocket, through all of the horror, decides his own fate by becoming a photographer and his ability is his way out of the ‘City’. Gangsters, guns and violence are so accepted that they become the norm to a new and much younger generation happy to perpetuate the lifestyle learned from birth, reinforced by poverty. Nominated for four Academy Awards. In Portuguese with English subtitles. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Mommie dearest
results.creator_credit: Frank Perry, Frank Yablans, Frank Yablans Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Faye Dunaway stars as screen legend Joan Crawford in this biographical feature about Joan’s life from her adopted daughter’s point of view. Joan Crawford was a powerful star produced by the Hollywood Studio System but as the old saying goes, money can’t buy happiness and she yearned to be a mother. As a single woman she adopted children but her dependence on alcohol led to the alleged abuse of the children and her personality at home is revealed to be controlling and overbearing. Script is based on the tell-all novel “Mommie Dearest” by Christina Crawford. Also stars Diana Scarwid as the older Christina.

results.title: Johnny got his gun
results.brief_description: This is the ultimate anti-war film by writer/director Dalton Trumbo. The setting is World War I and a nameless, armless, legless, faceless hospitalised soldier is found to be conscious despite the extreme condition that his body remains in after an explosion. His isolation and freakish state causes unease and anguish to the viewer. The horror that he faces is broken up through the film with flashbacks of the soldiers life before the war. “Johnny Got his Gun” is a very important film which is both thought-provoking and distressing. Trumbo received the 1971 Fipresci Prize and was nominated for the Golden Palm at Cannes. Cast includes Timothy Bottoms, Jason Robards, Donald Sutherland, David Soul and Diane Varsi.

results.title: The Quiet American (2001)
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Steffan Ahrenberg, William Horberg, IMF (DE), Mirage Enterprises and Intermedia
results.brief_description: Thomas Fowler (Michael Caine) is an embittered British Journalist working in Vietnam (then Indochina), covering the political situation. A man known for his professional objectivity and honesty, Fowler’s personal life is a fiasco. Involved with a local woman, Phuong (Do Thi Hai Yen), whom he loves, Fowler is married to a strictly religious woman back in England who refuses to divorce him. Into their lives steps an enigmatic American man (Brendan Fraser). The American man falls for Phuong, and asks only that Phuong be given the opportunity to choose between the men and (like Indochina), resolve her destiny. In danger of losing Phuong to the American, Fowler is drawn into a suspicious and venomous state, convinced that the American is supplying explosives to non-Communist troops. “The Quiet American” leaves the more contentious political elements of Graham Greene’s novel to languish in favour of highlighting the personal grief of a middle-aged man in crisis. This version directed by Phillip Noyce is a remake of the 1958 film directed by Joseph L. Mankiewicz. Filmed on location in Vietnam and Fox Studios, Sydney.

results.title: Raising Victor Vargas
results.creator_credit: Peter Sollett, Scott Macaulay, Robin O'hara, Alain de la Mata and Studio Canal
results.brief_description: Victor (Victor Rasuk) a New York City teenager gets caught trying to sleep with ‘Fat Donna’ when his younger sister Vicki (Krystal Rodriguez) realises what he’s up to and spreads the word in the neighbourhood. Victor, thinking his reputation has suffered a blow, quells the summer heat with a visit to the local public pool with his best friend Harold. Here he meets ‘Juicy Judy’ (Judy Marte) and he decides to pursue her. Living in a small apartment with his strict Grandmother, sister and piano-playing younger brother Nino (Rasuk’s real-life brother Silvestre), Victor finds life as a teenager challenging when he gets the blame for having a bad influence on his siblings. Coming-of-age is tough (and sometimes comical) for Victor as he finds real love, gets a glimpse of what manhood is about and asserts his place within the family. Based on the short film “Five Feet High and Rising” by its writer/director Peter Sollett. Cast also includes Kevin Rivera, Altagracia Guzman, Melonie Diaz.

description_for_label: Victor (Victor Rasuk) a New York City teenager gets caught trying to sleep with ‘Fat Donna’ when his younger sister Vicki (Krystal Rodriguez) realises what he’s up to and spreads the word in the neighbourhood. Victor, thinking his reputation has suffered a blow, quells the summer heat with a visit to the local public pool with his best friend Harold. Here he meets ‘Juicy Judy’ (Judy Marte) and he decides to pursue her. Living in a small apartment with his strict Grandmother, sister and piano-playing younger brother Nino (Rasuk’s real-life brother Silvestre), Victor finds life as a teenager challenging when he gets the blame for having a bad influence on his siblings. Coming-of-age is tough (and sometimes comical) for Victor as he finds real love, gets a glimpse of what manhood is about and asserts his place within the family. Based on the short film “Five Feet High and Rising” by its writer/director Peter Sollett. Cast also includes Kevin Rivera, Altagracia Guzman, Melonie Diaz.

results.title: American splendor
results.creator_credit: Shari Springer Berman, Robert Pulcini, Ted Hope, Fine Line Features and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: The life and times of American comic book writer Harvey Pekar - meet the real man, and the actor playing him (Paul Giamatti), in a movie about his “ordinary life”. Based on Harvey’s comic book “American Splendor” written by Harvey and illustrated by R.Crumb, he details the mundanities of ordinary life in such a way that makes for a great commentary on working class life in everyday America. The film covers the period of Harvey’s life when he gets divorced, looses his voice and compulsively collects old jazz records, to the time when he meets his new wife (Hope Davis), goes on the “Letterman” show to promote the comic, gets cancer and goes on to be part of this film. Cleverly realised we traverse his life via comics and actors, as well as interjections from the real Harvey, making an “ordinary life” quite compelling viewing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shari Springer Berman, Robert Pulcini, Ted Hope, Fine Line Features and Home Box Office
